intro: Actephila collinsiae, commonly known as Collins' actephila, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, particularly Florida and Georgia. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and swamps. It features heart-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of the wetland ecosystems it inhabits.
